de.dani09.http

Class HttpRequest

  • de.dani09.http.HttpRequest

  • public class HttpRequest

    With this class you can make Http requests to an Server to do that instance it add some Header etc. depending on what you need and then call the execute method to actually execute it

    You can make HttpRequests in an Builder like pattern because each method is returning the current instance

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpRequest(java.lang.String url, HttpMethod httpMethod)
      With this class you can make Http requests to an Server to do that instance it add some Header etc. depending on what you need and then call the execute method to actually execute it

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HttpRequest addProgressListener(HttpProgressListener listener)
      adds and ProgressListener to the HttpRequest to get the current status when the HttpRequest is executing

      adds an Request Header to the Request
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      Checks if this instance is the same as the passed Parameter
      HttpResponse execute()
      Executes the Http Request and returns the Response ResponseCode will be 0 if the Connection Timed Out
      java.util.concurrent.Future<de.dani09.http.HttpResponse> executeAsFuture()
      Executes the Http Request as a Future
      HttpResponse executeWithoutExceptions()
      Executes the Http Request and will not throw any Exception but will return null in case of an error instead
      HttpRequest followRedirects()
      Follows up to 10 Http redirects Default value if not called is 0
      HttpRequest handleRedirects(int maxRedirects)
      Sets the max allowed Redirects the HttpRequest will follow Default value is 0 to not follow them Default param value of this method is 1 to follow 1 redirect
      HttpRequest handleRedirects()
      Sets the max allowed Redirects the HttpRequest will follow Default value is 0 to not follow them Default param value of this method is 1 to follow 1 redirect
      int hashCode()
      Calculates the HashCode of this instance
      HttpRequest noKeepAlive()
      Sets the "Connection" Header to "close" to disable KeepAlive
      HttpRequest setContentType(java.lang.String contentType)
      Sets the Content-Type Header for this HttpRequest
      HttpRequest setOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream stream)
      set an OutputStream as an output of the HttpRequest if provided it will write the responseBody into this OutputStream instead of providing it to the HttpResponse Note that HttpResponse.getResponse will return an empty byteArray if an OutputStream is used!
      HttpRequest setReadBufferSize(int size)
      Sets the Buffer size for reading the Http Body into the OutputStream or ByteArray Default value is 2048
      HttpRequest setReadTimeOut(int readTimeout)
      Sets the maximal Socket Read Timeout in milliseconds for this HttpRequest Default value is 10000 0 stands for infinity
      HttpRequest setRequestBody(java.lang.String b, java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
      Sets the body for the HttpRequest

      Sets the body for the HttpRequest
      HttpRequest setRequestBody(org.json.JSONObject b)
      Sets the body for the HttpRequest
      HttpRequest setTimeOut(int timeout)
      Sets the maximal Socket Connect Timeout in milliseconds for this HttpRequest Default value is 10000 0 stands for infinity
      HttpRequest setUserAgent(java.lang.String userAgent)
      sets the UserAgent for the Request Default Value is "Mozilla/5.0"

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(java.lang.String url,
                   HttpMethod httpMethod)

        With this class you can make Http requests to an Server to do that instance it add some Header etc. depending on what you need and then call the execute method to actually execute it

        You can make HttpRequests in an Builder like pattern because each method is returning the current instance

        Parameters:
        url - the Url on which the Request will performed on
        httpMethod - the Http method that will be used to perform the Request

    • Method Detail

      • setUserAgent

        public HttpRequest setUserAgent(java.lang.String userAgent)

        sets the UserAgent for the Request Default Value is "Mozilla/5.0"

      • addRequestHeader

        public HttpRequest addRequestHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                                    java.lang.String headerValue)

        adds an Request Header to the Request

      • setContentType

        public HttpRequest setContentType(java.lang.String contentType)

        Sets the Content-Type Header for this HttpRequest

        Parameters:
        contentType - the Content-Type you wish to set

      • noKeepAlive

        public HttpRequest noKeepAlive()

        Sets the "Connection" Header to "close" to disable KeepAlive

      • setRequestBody

        public HttpRequest setRequestBody(java.lang.String b,
                                  java.nio.charset.Charset charset)

        Sets the body for the HttpRequest

        Parameters:
        b - the Body in a String
        charset - the used Charset for the conversion to Bytes

      • setTimeOut

        public HttpRequest setTimeOut(int timeout)

        Sets the maximal Socket Connect Timeout in milliseconds for this HttpRequest Default value is 10000 0 stands for infinity

      • setReadTimeOut

        public HttpRequest setReadTimeOut(int readTimeout)

        Sets the maximal Socket Read Timeout in milliseconds for this HttpRequest Default value is 10000 0 stands for infinity

      • handleRedirects

        public HttpRequest handleRedirects(int maxRedirects)

        Sets the max allowed Redirects the HttpRequest will follow Default value is 0 to not follow them Default param value of this method is 1 to follow 1 redirect

        Parameters:
        maxRedirects - maximum allowed Redirects to follow

      • handleRedirects

        public HttpRequest handleRedirects()

        Sets the max allowed Redirects the HttpRequest will follow Default value is 0 to not follow them Default param value of this method is 1 to follow 1 redirect

      • followRedirects

        public HttpRequest followRedirects()

        Follows up to 10 Http redirects Default value if not called is 0

        See Also:
        HttpRequest.handleRedirects

      • addProgressListener

        public HttpRequest addProgressListener(HttpProgressListener listener)

        adds and ProgressListener to the HttpRequest to get the current status when the HttpRequest is executing

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener you want to add
        See Also:
        interface HttpProgressListener

      • setOutputStream

        public HttpRequest setOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream stream)

        set an OutputStream as an output of the HttpRequest if provided it will write the responseBody into this OutputStream instead of providing it to the HttpResponse Note that HttpResponse.getResponse will return an empty byteArray if an OutputStream is used!

        Parameters:
        stream - the OutputStream that should be written the http body to

      • setReadBufferSize

        public HttpRequest setReadBufferSize(int size)

        Sets the Buffer size for reading the Http Body into the OutputStream or ByteArray Default value is 2048

        Parameters:
        size - the Buffer size in bytes
        Throws:
        - if the buffer is smaller than 1

      • execute

        public HttpResponse execute()

        Executes the Http Request and returns the Response ResponseCode will be 0 if the Connection Timed Out

        Returns:
        will return the HttpResponse of the executed HttpRequest

      • executeWithoutExceptions

        public HttpResponse executeWithoutExceptions()

        Executes the Http Request and will not throw any Exception but will return null in case of an error instead

        See Also:
        HttpRequest.execute

      • executeAsFuture

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<de.dani09.http.HttpResponse> executeAsFuture()

        Executes the Http Request as a Future

        See Also:
        HttpRequest.execute
